catalog

Class LibraryCatalog

  • java.lang.Object
    • catalog.LibraryCatalog

  • public class LibraryCatalog
extends java.lang.Object
    LibraryCatalog Class - represents a collection of books, where each book can be "checked out" and "returned".

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LibraryCatalog()
      Constructor for LibraryCatalog

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBook(Book book)
      Adds a book to the ArrayList of books.
      void addBooksFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
      Reads the file with the given filename line by line; extracts book title, author, year and average rating from each line; creates a Book object, and adds it to the ArrayList of books.
      boolean checkoutBook(java.lang.String title)
      Checks out the book with the given title from the library.
      Book findBook(java.lang.String title)
      Searches for the book with the given title in the ArrayList "books" and returns the book.
      java.lang.String getAvailableBooks()
      Returns a String containing books that are available for checkout
      boolean returnBook(java.lang.String title)
      Returns the book with the given title to the library.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string that contains information about all books from the catalog; one book per line in the same format as in toString method in class Book.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LibraryCatalog

        public LibraryCatalog()
        Constructor for LibraryCatalog

    • Method Detail

      • addBook

        public void addBook(Book book)
        Adds a book to the ArrayList of books.
        Parameters:
        book - book to be added to the catalog

      • findBook

        public Book findBook(java.lang.String title)
        Searches for the book with the given title in the ArrayList "books" and returns the book. Returns null if there is no book with this title.
        Parameters:
        title - title of the book
        Returns:
        reference to the Book with the given title

      • checkoutBook

        public boolean checkoutBook(java.lang.String title)
        Checks out the book with the given title from the library. First, searches for the book with the given title, and then checks it out (by calling the corresponding method in class Book) if it is not currently checked out. The method returns true if it was able to check out the book, otherwise false.
        Parameters:
        title - title of the book
        Returns:
        true if was able to checkout a book, false otherwise

      • returnBook

        public boolean returnBook(java.lang.String title)
        Returns the book with the given title to the library. If the book is in the ArrayList of books, has the matching title and is currently checked out, the method is going to "return" it (by calling the returnBook() method of class Book.
        Parameters:
        title - title of the book to return
        Returns:
        true if was able to return the book, false otherwise

      • addBooksFromFile

        public void addBooksFromFile(java.lang.String filename)
        Reads the file with the given filename line by line; extracts book title, author, year and average rating from each line; creates a Book object, and adds it to the ArrayList of books.
        Parameters:
        filename - name of the file that contains books info

      • getAvailableBooks

        public java.lang.String getAvailableBooks()
        Returns a String containing books that are available for checkout
        Returns:
        string with books that are not checked out

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string that contains information about all books from the catalog; one book per line in the same format as in toString method in class Book. Important: instead of adding newline character using "\n", add System.lineSeparator() - it will return the system-dependent line separator
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation of the library catalog
